wikipedia_page.main:
Leonard Haigh (19 October 1880 – 6 August 1916) was an English rugby player. He won seven caps for England between 1910 and 1911, and also represented Manchester and Lancashire.
He enlisted with the Army Service Corps at the start of the First World War, and died of pneumonia, which he contracted while on a training exercise. He is buried in Pott Shrigley cemetery.

response: * Leonard Haigh, (7) died on 6 August 1916 Aged 29.CWGC – Haigh
